result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lynn M Nolan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA HEARING Transcript (9 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 3, 2015 received and filed.
from the defense received and filed.

Defendant Lynn M Nolan in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered case dismissed and read-in for sentencing.

Defendant Lynn M Nolan in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The parties informed the court that the records that they were trying to obtain will not be released from the entity unless they have a court order.  The court will sign the order if the district attorney presents one to the court.  Case is calendared for another motion hearing in Branch 36.  The court will review the records by the next court date.
  Motion hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.

Defendant Lynn M Nolan in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called with case 14CF5728 and co-defendant's (Barry Gaither) cases 14CF5727. Parties stipulation to severing cases 14CF5728 & 15CF2214 from Defendant Gaither's case 14CF5727.  State's motion for joinder of 14CF572 & 15CF2214 for trial. Court VACATED Jury Trial date of 9/14/2015.  Defense counsel requests cases be set for a Motion Hearing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. State ordered to provide the court with physiological reports for further determination as to further use. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Motion For Psychological Examination of Complaining Witness.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Motion For In Camera Inspection.
Received & Filed, Cover Letter & Defendant's Motion To Dismiss.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion for Joinder.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.J.G.

Defendant Lynn M Nolan in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
